title: Ancient Domains of Mystery
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Ancient Domains of Mystery](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Domains_of_Mystery "wikipedia:Ancient Domains of Mystery")***

[![RogueBasin](/images/thumb/d/d9/RogueBasin_logo.png/50px-RogueBasin_logo.png)](/wiki/File:RogueBasin_logo.png "RogueBasin")

[RogueBasin](/wiki/RogueBasin "RogueBasin") has a wiki page about:

***[ADOM](https://roguebasin.com?title=ADOM)***

***Ancient Domains of Mystery*** (***ADOM***) is a [roguelike](/wiki/Roguelike "Roguelike") game in which the player must stop the forces of Chaos.

[Roguebasin](/wiki/Roguebasin "Roguebasin") classifies both *ADOM* and *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* as [Hacklikes](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Hacklike "roguebasin:Hacklike"), as opposed to [Angband](/wiki/Angband "Angband") and similar games which are [Band](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Band "roguebasin:Band"). So a contrast of *ADOM* and *NetHack* is fundamentally different from a contrast of *NetHack* and *Angband*.

*ADOM* and *NetHack* both have [persistent levels](/wiki/Persistent_level "Persistent level") (*Angband* does not). They both have a [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") system (in *Angband*, curses as such apply only to worn items). They both have [gods](/wiki/God "God") and [alignments](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") (*Angband* does not). You [pray](/wiki/Pray "Pray") when in trouble. Both *ADOM* and *NetHack* [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") are rooms with items on the floor (*Angband* shops are menus).

*ADOM* is much larger and more difficult than *NetHack*, while *NetHack* has some nice features and detail that *ADOM* lacks. A common summary of the games is that *ADOM* has more breadth, while *NetHack* has more depth. Eva Myer's [*NetHack* vs *ADOM*](https://sites.google.com/view/evasroguelikegamessite/nethack-vs-adom) page has two sections, each listing why one game is better than the other. [NetHack vs. ADOM@Everything2.com](https://everything2.com/index.pl?node_id=572276) has three (and potentially more) attempts at contrasting the two games.

## Getting started

*NetHack* players attempting to install *ADOM* on their computer (even if they already run other roguelike games) might not expect certain problems that can happen: the source code of *ADOM* is not public and cannot be compiled for [Unix](/wiki/Unix "Unix") or other operating systems. Unless there is an *ADOM* binary for your platform (Windows, Mac, DOS, and Linux), then an emulator such as [DOSBox](https://dosbox.sourceforge.net/) or workarounds such as [installing FreeDOS in QEMU](http://community.wikia.com/wiki/c:howto:Howto_install_FreeDOS_in_QEMU "w:c:howto:Howto install FreeDOS in QEMU") will be required.

The author requests that those who play and enjoy *ADOM* embark upon the "[Postcard Quest](http://www.adom.de/adom/postcard.php3)", which means sending him a postcard to his home in [Germany](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany "wikipedia:Germany").

## External links

- [Official *ADOM* site](https://www.adom.de/)
- [*ADOM* downloads](https://www.adom.de/home/downloads.html)
- [*ADOM* wiki](https://ancardia.wikia.com/wiki/ADOM_Wiki)
- [*ADOM* guidebook](http://www.adomgb.info/adomgb-toc.html)
html:
Ancient Domains of Mystery

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Ancient Domains of Mystery
RogueBasin has a wiki page about:
ADOM

Ancient Domains of Mystery (ADOM) is a roguelike game in which the player must stop the forces of Chaos.

Roguebasin classifies both ADOM and NetHack as Hacklikes, as opposed to Angband and similar games which are Band. So a contrast of ADOM and NetHack is fundamentally different from a contrast of NetHack and Angband.

ADOM and NetHack both have persistent levels (Angband does not). They both have a BUC system (in Angband, curses as such apply only to worn items). They both have gods and alignments (Angband does not). You pray when in trouble. Both ADOM and NetHack shops are rooms with items on the floor (Angband shops are menus).

ADOM is much larger and more difficult than NetHack, while NetHack has some nice features and detail that ADOM lacks. A common summary of the games is that ADOM has more breadth, while NetHack has more depth. Eva Myer's NetHack vs ADOM page has two sections, each listing why one game is better than the other. NetHack vs. ADOM@Everything2.com has three (and potentially more) attempts at contrasting the two games.

Getting started

NetHack players attempting to install ADOM on their computer (even if they already run other roguelike games) might not expect certain problems that can happen: the source code of ADOM is not public and cannot be compiled for Unix or other operating systems. Unless there is an ADOM binary for your platform (Windows, Mac, DOS, and Linux), then an emulator such as DOSBox or workarounds such as installing FreeDOS in QEMU will be required.

The author requests that those who play and enjoy ADOM embark upon the "Postcard Quest", which means sending him a postcard to his home in Germany.

External links

  • Official ADOM site
  • ADOM downloads
  • ADOM wiki
  • ADOM guidebook

rawPage:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:''Ancient Domains of Mystery''}}
{{wikipedia|Ancient Domains of Mystery}}
{{RogueBasin|ADOM}}

'''''Ancient Domains of Mystery''''' ('''''ADOM''''') is a [[roguelike]] game in which the player must stop the forces of Chaos.

[[Roguebasin]] classifies both ''ADOM'' and ''[[NetHack]]'' as [[roguebasin:Hacklike|Hacklikes]], as opposed to [[Angband]] and similar games which are [[roguebasin:Band|Band]]. So a contrast of ''ADOM'' and ''NetHack'' is fundamentally different from a contrast of ''NetHack'' and ''Angband''.

''ADOM'' and ''NetHack'' both have [[persistent level]]s (''Angband'' does not). They both have a [[BUC]] system (in ''Angband'', curses as such apply only to worn items). They both have [[god]]s and [[alignment]]s (''Angband'' does not). You [[pray]] when in trouble. Both ''ADOM'' and ''NetHack'' [[shop]]s are rooms with items on the floor (''Angband'' shops are menus).

''ADOM'' is much larger and more difficult than ''NetHack'', while ''NetHack'' has some nice features and detail that ''ADOM'' lacks. A common summary of the games is that ''ADOM'' has more breadth, while ''NetHack'' has more depth. Eva Myer's [https://sites.google.com/view/evasroguelikegamessite/nethack-vs-adom ''NetHack'' vs ''ADOM''] page has two sections, each listing why one game is better than the other. [https://everything2.com/index.pl?node_id=572276 NetHack vs. ADOM@Everything2.com] has three (and potentially more) attempts at contrasting the two games.

== Getting started ==
''NetHack'' players attempting to install ''ADOM'' on their computer (even if they already run other roguelike games) might not expect certain problems that can happen: the source code of ''ADOM'' is not public and cannot be compiled for [[Unix]] or other operating systems. Unless there is an ''ADOM'' binary for your platform (Windows, Mac, DOS, and Linux), then an emulator such as [https://dosbox.sourceforge.net/ DOSBox] or workarounds such as [[w:c:howto:Howto install FreeDOS in QEMU|installing FreeDOS in QEMU]] will be required.

The author requests that those who play and enjoy ''ADOM'' embark upon the "[http://www.adom.de/adom/postcard.php3 Postcard Quest]", which means sending him a postcard to his home in [[Wikipedia:Germany|Germany]].

==External links==
*[https://www.adom.de/ Official ''ADOM'' site]
*[https://www.adom.de/home/downloads.html ''ADOM'' downloads]
*[https://ancardia.wikia.com/wiki/ADOM_Wiki ''ADOM'' wiki]
*[http://www.adomgb.info/adomgb-toc.html ''ADOM'' guidebook]
